UpdateParams defines a (governance) operation for updating the module
parameters. The authority defaults to the x/gov module account.

parameters.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: MsgCreateAsset is the Msg/CreateAsset request type.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: MsgTransferAssetController is the Msg/TransferAssetController request type.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: MsgUpdateAssetMetadata is the Msg/UpdateAssetMetadata request type.
parameters.name: body

UpdateParams defines a (governance) operation for updating the module
parameters. The authority defaults to the x/gov module account.

parameters.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.
parameters.name: body

post.summary: AddPublicKey adds a new public key to a DID document
DeactivateDID deactivates a DID, preventing further updates
IssueCredential issues a new Verifiable Credential
RegisterDID registers a new Decentralized Identifier (DID) with its document
RegisterDeviceKey registers a device's public key for IoT authentication
ResumeCredential resumes a previously suspended Verifiable Credential
RevokeCredential revokes a previously issued Verifiable Credential
RevokeDeviceKey revokes a device's public key
RevokePublicKey revokes a public key from a DID document
RotateDeviceKey rotates a device's public key
SuspendCredential suspends a Verifiable Credential (temporary revocation)
UpdateDIDDocument updates an existing DID document

UpdateParams defines a (governance) operation for updating the module
parameters. The authority defaults to the x/gov module account.

parameters.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.
parameters.name: body

get.summary: Parameters queries the parameters of the module.
Asset Queries a list of Asset items.
AssetsByController Queries a list of AssetsByController items.

parameters.description:
key is a value returned in PageResponse.next_key to begin
querying the next page most efficiently. Only one of offset or key
should be set.
parameters.name: pagination.key

parameters.description:
offset is a numeric offset that can be used when key is unavailable.
It is less efficient than using key. Only one of offset or key should
be set.
parameters.name: pagination.offset

parameters.description:
limit is the total number of results to be returned in the result page.
If left empty it will default to a value to be set by each app.
parameters.name: pagination.limit

parameters.description:
count_total is set to true  to indicate that the result set should include
a count of the total number of items available for pagination in UIs.
count_total is only respected when offset is used. It is ignored when key
is set.
parameters.name: pagination.count_total

parameters.description: reverse is set to true if results are to be returned in the descending order.
parameters.name: pagination.reverse

acmain.acmain.v1.MsgUpdateParams.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.

authority.description: authority is the address that controls the module (defaults to x/gov unless overwritten).

params.description:
params defines the module parameters to update.

NOTE: All parameters must be supplied.

acmain.acmain.v1.MsgUpdateParamsResponse.description:
MsgUpdateParamsResponse defines the response structure for executing a
MsgUpdateParams message.

acmain.acmain.v1.Params.description: Params defines the parameters for the module.

acmain.acmain.v1.QueryParamsResponse.description: QueryParamsResponse is response type for the Query/Params RPC method.

params.description: params holds all the parameters of this module.

asset_id.description:
asset_id is the unique identifier for this asset within the system.
Immutable after creation.

asset_type.description: asset_type specifies the type of physical asset (door, gate, barrier, etc).

controller_address.description:
controller_address is the Cosmos address of the entity that controls
this asset. Only the controller can update asset state and modify ACLs.
Typically the organization/facility manager.

created_at.description:
created_at is the block timestamp when this asset was created.
Immutable after creation.

description.description: description is an optional human-readable description of the asset.

location.description:
location contains the immutable location binding for this asset.
Assets are location-scoped: an asset from Building A cannot be used
to grant access in Building B. This is enforced at network and app level.

metadata.description:
metadata is optional key-value data for asset-specific attributes.
Examples: model_number, serial_number, manufacturer, firmware_version, etc.
Maps are used to support arbitrary metadata without schema changes.

name.description: name is a human-readable name for the asset.

state.description:
state is the current operational state of the asset.
Updated via MsgUpdateAssetState transactions.

updated_at.description:
updated_at is the block timestamp of the most recent state update.
Updated whenever asset state changes or metadata is modified.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.AssetState.description:
AssetState defines the enum of supported asset operational states.

 - ASSET_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: ASSET_STATE_UNSPECIFIED represents an unspecified state
 - ASSET_STATE_LOCKED: ASSET_STATE_LOCKED represents a locked asset
 - ASSET_STATE_UNLOCKED: ASSET_STATE_UNLOCKED represents an unlocked asset
 - ASSET_STATE_OPEN: ASSET_STATE_OPEN represents an open asset
 - ASSET_STATE_CLOSED: ASSET_STATE_CLOSED represents a closed asset
 - ASSET_STATE_MAINTENANCE: ASSET_STATE_MAINTENANCE represents an asset in maintenance
 - ASSET_STATE_OFFLINE: ASSET_STATE_OFFLINE represents an offline asset
 - ASSET_STATE_DEACTIVATED: ASSET_STATE_DEACTIVATED represents a deactivated asset

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.AssetType.description:
AssetType defines the enum of supported physical asset types.

 - ASSET_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ASSET_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED represents an unspecified asset type
 - ASSET_TYPE_DOOR: ASSET_TYPE_DOOR represents a physical door asset
 - ASSET_TYPE_GATE: ASSET_TYPE_GATE represents a physical gate asset
 - ASSET_TYPE_BARRIER: ASSET_TYPE_BARRIER represents a physical barrier asset
 - ASSET_TYPE_ELEVATOR: ASSET_TYPE_ELEVATOR represents an elevator asset
 - ASSET_TYPE_TURNSTILE: ASSET_TYPE_TURNSTILE represents a turnstile asset

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.LocationInfo.description:
LocationInfo encodes the physical location of an asset with building,
floor, and zone identifiers. This serves as the primary location binding
for location-based access control policies.

building_id.description:
building_id is the unique identifier for the building/facility.
This is the primary location scope identifier.

floor_id.description: floor_id is the unique identifier for the floor within the building.

latitude_microdegrees.title:
latitude_microdegrees is the latitude in microdegrees (degrees * 1e6)
Range: -90000000 to 90000000 (~0.11 meter precision)
Use fixed-point representation to ensure deterministic state across all nodes.
To convert: degrees * 1000000 = microdegrees

longitude_microdegrees.title:
longitude_microdegrees is the longitude in microdegrees (degrees * 1e6)
Range: -180000000 to 180000000
Use fixed-point representation to ensure deterministic state across all nodes.
To convert: degrees * 1000000 = microdegrees

zone_id.description: zone_id is the unique identifier for the zone/area on the floor.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgCreateAsset.description: MsgCreateAsset is the Msg/CreateAsset request type.

asset_id.title: asset_id is the unique identifier for this asset

asset_type.title: asset_type specifies the type of physical asset

controller_address.title: controller_address is the address that controls this asset

creator.title: creator is the address of the entity creating the asset

description.title: description is an optional description of the asset

location.title: location contains the location binding for this asset

metadata.title: metadata is optional key-value data for asset-specific attributes

name.title: name is a human-readable name for the asset

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgCreateAssetRespon.description: MsgCreateAssetResponse is the Msg/CreateAsset response type.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgTransferAssetCont.description: MsgTransferAssetController is the Msg/TransferAssetController request type.

asset_id.title: asset_id is the ID of the asset to transfer

current_controller.title: current_controller is the address of the current controller

new_controller.title: new_controller is the address of the new controller

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgTransferAssetCont.description: MsgTransferAssetControllerResponse is the Msg/TransferAssetController response type.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateAssetMetada.description: MsgUpdateAssetMetadata is the Msg/UpdateAssetMetadata request type.

asset_id.title: asset_id is the ID of the asset to update

controller.title: controller is the address of the asset controller

metadata.title: metadata is the new metadata to set (replaces existing)

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateAssetMetada.description: MsgUpdateAssetMetadataResponse is the Msg/UpdateAssetMetadata response type.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateAssetState.description: MsgUpdateAssetState is the Msg/UpdateAssetState request type.

asset_id.title: asset_id is the ID of the asset to update

controller.title: controller is the address of the asset controller

new_state.title: new_state is the new operational state

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateAssetStateR.description: MsgUpdateAssetStateResponse is the Msg/UpdateAssetState response type.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateParams.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.

authority.description: authority is the address that controls the module (defaults to x/gov unless overwritten).

params.description:
params defines the module parameters to update.

NOTE: All parameters must be supplied.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.MsgUpdateParamsRespo.description:
MsgUpdateParamsResponse defines the response structure for executing a
MsgUpdateParams message.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.Params.description: Params defines the parameters for the module.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.QueryAssetsByControl.description:
QueryAssetsByControllerResponse defines the QueryAssetsByControllerResponse message.
QueryAssetsByControllerResponse is the response type for Query/AssetsByController RPC method.

assets.description: assets is the list of assets controlled by the specified address.
assets is the list of assets in the specified location.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.QueryAssetsByStateRe.description: QueryAssetsByStateResponse is the response type for Query/AssetsByState RPC method.

assets.description: assets is the list of assets in the specified state.
assets is the list of assets of the specified type.

acmain.assetmgmt.v1.QueryParamsResponse.description: QueryParamsResponse is response type for the Query/Params RPC method.

params.description: params holds all the parameters of this module.

acmain.iam.v1.CredentialProof.title: CredentialProof represents the cryptographic proof of a verifiable credential

created_at.title: created_at is when the proof was created

proof_value.title: proof_value is the signature bytes (base64 encoded in JSON)

verification_method.title: verification_method is the DID method used to verify (e.g., "#key-1")

acmain.iam.v1.CredentialStatus.title: CredentialStatus defines the status of a verifiable credential

acmain.iam.v1.CredentialStatusInfo.title: CredentialStatusInfo tracks the status of a credential

revocation_reason.title: revocation_reason describes why the credential was revoked/suspended

status.title: status is the current status of the credential

updated_at.title: updated_at is when the status was last updated

acmain.iam.v1.CredentialSubject.title: CredentialSubject represents the subject of a verifiable credential

id.title: id is the DID of the subject

acmain.iam.v1.CredentialType.title: CredentialType defines the type of verifiable credential

acmain.iam.v1.DIDDocument.title:
DIDDocument represents a W3C-compliant DID Document adapted for Cosmos
This is the canonical form stored on-chain

context.title: context defines the JSON-LD context (stored as strings for protobuf)

controller.title: controller is the address that can update this DID document

created_at.title: created_at is the block timestamp when the DID was created

deactivated.title: deactivated indicates if the DID is deactivated

deactivated_at.title: deactivated_at is the block timestamp when the DID was deactivated

did_method.title: did_method specifies which DID method is used

public_keys.title: public_keys are all public keys associated with this DID

service_endpoints.title: service_endpoints describe external services (e.g., website, API endpoints)

updated_at.title: updated_at is the block timestamp of the last update

verification_relationships.title: verification_relationships define how keys are used

acmain.iam.v1.DIDMethod.description:
- DID_METHOD_acmain: acmain: method - primary method for this system
 - DID_METHOD_KEY: did:key: method - lightweight, no registry required
 - DID_METHOD_WEB: did:web: method - web-based DID resolution
acmain.iam.v1.DIDMethod.title: DIDMethod defines the DID method type

acmain.iam.v1.DeviceKey.title: DeviceKey represents a registered device's public key information

active.title: active indicates if the device key is currently active

device_id.title: device_id is the unique identifier for the IoT device

last_rotation_at.title: last_rotation_at is the timestamp of last key rotation

location.title: location is where the device is physically located

owner.title: owner is the Cosmos address that owns this device

public_key.title: public_key is the device's public key

registered_at.title: registered_at is the block timestamp of registration

revoked_at.title: revoked_at indicates if/when the key was revoked

acmain.iam.v1.KeyType.title: KeyType defines the cryptographic key type

acmain.iam.v1.MsgAddPublicKey.title: MsgAddPublicKey adds a new public key to a DID document

controller.title: controller is the address authorized to add keys

did.title: did is the DID to which the key is added

key_id.title: key_id is the unique identifier for this key within the DID

purpose.title: purpose describes the key's intended purpose (e.g., "authentication", "assertionMethod")

acmain.iam.v1.MsgAddPublicKeyResponse.title: MsgAddPublicKeyResponse defines the response for AddPublicKey

public_key_info.title: public_key_info is the added key information

acmain.iam.v1.MsgDeactivateDID.title: MsgDeactivateDID deactivates a DID, preventing further modifications

controller.title: controller is the address authorized to deactivate the DID

did.title: did is the DID to deactivate

acmain.iam.v1.MsgDeactivateDIDResponse.title: MsgDeactivateDIDResponse defines the response for DeactivateDID

acmain.iam.v1.MsgIssueCredential.title: MsgIssueCredential issues a new Verifiable Credential

claims.title:
claims are the credential attributes (key-value pairs)
e.g., "role": "engineer", "department": "platform", "clearance": "level-2"

credential_type.title: credential_type is the semantic type of the credential

issuer.title: issuer is the Cosmos address issuing the credential

refresh_service.title: refresh_service optional service endpoint for credential renewal

signature.title:
signature is the issuer's signature over the canonical credential data
This proves the issuer authorized the credential issuance

subject.title: subject is the DID of the credential subject

valid_from.title: valid_from is the earliest time the credential is valid (optional)

valid_until.title: valid_until is the expiration time of the credential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgIssueCredentialResponse.title: MsgIssueCredentialResponse defines the response for IssueCredential

credential_id.title: credential_id is the unique identifier of the issued credential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRegisterDID.title: MsgRegisterDID registers a new Decentralized Identifier with a DID document

controller.title: controller is the Cosmos address that will control this DID

did.title: did is the full DID string (e.g., "did:acmain:cosmos1abcdef...")

did_method.title: did_method specifies which DID method is being used

public_key.title: public_key is the initial public key for this DID

service_endpoints.title: service_endpoints optional service endpoints (e.g., API, website)

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRegisterDIDResponse.title: MsgRegisterDIDResponse defines the response for RegisterDID

did_document.title: did_document is the created DID document

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRegisterDeviceKey.title: MsgRegisterDeviceKey registers an IoT device's public key

device_id.title: device_id is the unique identifier for the IoT device

location.title: location is where the device is physically located (e.g., building_id, floor, zone)

owner.title: owner is the Cosmos address that owns/registers the device

public_key.title: public_key is the device's public key

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRegisterDeviceKeyRespon.title: MsgRegisterDeviceKeyResponse defines the response for RegisterDeviceKey

device_key.title: device_key is the registered device key information

acmain.iam.v1.MsgResumeCredential.title: MsgResumeCredential resumes a previously suspended Verifiable Credential

credential_id.title: credential_id is the unique identifier of the credential to resume

issuer.title: issuer is the address that issued the credential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgResumeCredentialRespons.title: MsgResumeCredentialResponse defines the response for ResumeCredential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokeCredential.title: MsgRevokeCredential revokes a previously issued Verifiable Credential

credential_id.title: credential_id is the unique identifier of the credential to revoke

issuer.title: issuer is the address that issued the credential (must match original issuer)

revocation_reason.title: revocation_reason describes why the credential was revoked

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokeCredentialRespons.title: MsgRevokeCredentialResponse defines the response for RevokeCredential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokeDeviceKey.title: MsgRevokeDeviceKey revokes a device's public key

device_id.title: device_id is the unique identifier of the device

owner.title: owner is the address that owns the device

revocation_reason.title: revocation_reason describes why the key is revoked

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokeDeviceKeyResponse.title: MsgRevokeDeviceKeyResponse defines the response for RevokeDeviceKey

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokePublicKey.title: MsgRevokePublicKey revokes a public key from a DID document

controller.title: controller is the address authorized to revoke keys

did.title: did is the DID from which the key is revoked

key_id.title: key_id is the identifier of the key to revoke

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRevokePublicKeyResponse.title: MsgRevokePublicKeyResponse defines the response for RevokePublicKey

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRotateDeviceKey.title: MsgRotateDeviceKey rotates a device's public key

device_id.title: device_id is the unique identifier of the device

new_public_key.title: new_public_key is the replacement public key

owner.title: owner is the address that owns the device

acmain.iam.v1.MsgRotateDeviceKeyResponse.title: MsgRotateDeviceKeyResponse defines the response for RotateDeviceKey

device_key.title: device_key is the updated device key information

acmain.iam.v1.MsgSuspendCredential.title: MsgSuspendCredential temporarily suspends a Verifiable Credential

credential_id.title: credential_id is the unique identifier of the credential to suspend

issuer.title: issuer is the address that issued the credential

suspension_reason.title: suspension_reason describes why the credential is suspended

acmain.iam.v1.MsgSuspendCredentialRespon.title: MsgSuspendCredentialResponse defines the response for SuspendCredential

acmain.iam.v1.MsgUpdateDIDDocument.title: MsgUpdateDIDDocument updates an existing DID document

controller.title: controller is the address authorized to update the DID

did.title: did is the DID to update

acmain.iam.v1.MsgUpdateDIDDocumentRespon.title: MsgUpdateDIDDocumentResponse defines the response for UpdateDIDDocument

did_document.title: did_document is the updated DID document

acmain.iam.v1.MsgUpdateParams.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.

authority.description: authority is the address that controls the module (defaults to x/gov unless overwritten).

params.description:
params defines the module parameters to update.

NOTE: All parameters must be supplied.

acmain.iam.v1.MsgUpdateParamsResponse.description:
MsgUpdateParamsResponse defines the response structure for executing a
MsgUpdateParams message.

acmain.iam.v1.Params.description: Params defines the parameters for the module.

controller.title: controller is the DID that controls this key (can differ from subject)

created_at.title: created_at is the block timestamp when the key was added

key_id.title: key_id is a unique identifier for the key within the DID document

public_key.title: public_key is the raw public key bytes

revoked_at.title: revoked_at is the block timestamp when the key was revoked (null if active)

acmain.iam.v1.QueryCredentialResponse.title: QueryCredentialResponse is the response type for Query/Credential RPC method

acmain.iam.v1.QueryCredentialsByIssuerRe.title: QueryCredentialsByIssuerResponse is the response type for Query/CredentialsByIssuer RPC method

total_issued.title: total_issued is the total number of credentials issued by this issuer

acmain.iam.v1.QueryCredentialsBySubjectR.title: QueryCredentialsBySubjectResponse is the response type for Query/CredentialsBySubject RPC method

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDIDResponse.title: QueryDIDResponse is the response type for Query/DID RPC method

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDIDsByControllerRespo.title: QueryDIDsByControllerResponse is the response type for Query/DIDsByController RPC method

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDIDsResponse.title: QueryDIDsResponse is the response type for Query/DIDs RPC method

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDeviceKeyResponse.title: QueryDeviceKeyResponse is the response type for Query/DeviceKey RPC method

device_key.title: device_key is the device's key information

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDeviceKeysByLocationR.title: QueryDeviceKeysByLocationResponse is the response type for Query/DeviceKeysByLocation RPC method

device_keys.title: device_keys are the devices at the location

total_count.title: total_count is the total number of devices at this location

acmain.iam.v1.QueryDeviceKeysByOwnerResp.title: QueryDeviceKeysByOwnerResponse is the response type for Query/DeviceKeysByOwner RPC method

device_keys.title: device_keys are the owner's device keys

acmain.iam.v1.QueryIsCredentialValidResp.title: QueryIsCredentialValidResponse is the response type for Query/IsCredentialValid RPC method

expires_at.title: expires_at is the expiration time (null if already expired)

reason.title: reason explains why the credential is invalid (empty if valid)

status.title: status is the current credential status

valid.title: valid indicates if the credential is valid

acmain.iam.v1.QueryParamsResponse.description: QueryParamsResponse is response type for the Query/Params RPC method.

params.description: params holds all the parameters of this module.

acmain.iam.v1.QueryPublicKeyResponse.title: QueryPublicKeyResponse is the response type for Query/PublicKey RPC method

public_key_info.title: public_key_info is the public key information

acmain.iam.v1.ServiceEndpoint.title: ServiceEndpoint represents a service endpoint in the DID document

id.title: id is the unique identifier for the service endpoint

service_endpoint.title: service_endpoint is the URL or endpoint address

acmain.iam.v1.VerifiableCredential.title: VerifiableCredential represents a W3C Verifiable Credential

credential_subject.title: credential_subject is the subject and their claims

credential_type.title: credential_type is the semantic type of the credential

holder.title: holder is the DID of the entity that holds this credential

id.title: id is the unique identifier for this credential

issued_at.title: issued_at is the block timestamp when credential was issued

issuer.title: issuer is the address/DID that issued this credential

proof.title: proof is the cryptographic proof of the credential

valid_from.title: valid_from is the earliest time the credential is valid

valid_until.title: valid_until is the expiration time of the credential

acmain.iam.v1.VerificationRelationship.title: VerificationRelationship represents a verification relationship in DID document

key_id.title: key_id references a key in the DID document

cosmos.base.query.v1beta1.PageRequest.title:
PageRequest is to be embedded in gRPC request messages for efficient
pagination. Ex:

count_total.description:
count_total is set to true  to indicate that the result set should include
a count of the total number of items available for pagination in UIs.
count_total is only respected when offset is used. It is ignored when key
is set.

key.description:
key is a value returned in PageResponse.next_key to begin
querying the next page most efficiently. Only one of offset or key
should be set.

limit.description:
limit is the total number of results to be returned in the result page.
If left empty it will default to a value to be set by each app.

offset.description:
offset is a numeric offset that can be used when key is unavailable.
It is less efficient than using key. Only one of offset or key should
be set.

reverse.description: reverse is set to true if results are to be returned in the descending order.

next_key.description:
next_key is the key to be passed to PageRequest.key to
query the next page most efficiently. It will be empty if
there are no more results.

total.title:
total is total number of results available if PageRequest.count_total
was set, its value is undefined otherwise
